arm_group.description:
Mothers will receive the intervention for 1 month beginning when their infant is 0.5 months old.
Intervention: Timing of Diet and Flavor Experience

Mothers will receive the intervention for 1 month beginning when their infant is 1.5 months old.
Intervention: Timing of Diet and Flavor Experience

Mothers will receive the intervention for 3 months beginning when their infant is 0.5 months old.
Intervention: Timing of Diet and Flavor Experience
Mothers will not receive the intervention.

brief_summary.textblock:
The goals of the proposed research are to specify the timing and consequences of the
      sensitive period for flavor learning in infants who are being breastfed or formula fed. The
      investigators will conduct a randomized within- and between-subject study of women and their
      infants during a 15-month window.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sensitive Periods in Human Flavor Learning

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a randomized clinical trial on both breastfeeding and formula feeding infants to
      determine the effects of the timing of flavor experiences on subsequent food acceptance in
      both members of the dyad.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy, term infants and their mothers

          -  Infants 2 wks (+/- 2 wk of age)

          -  Mothers and infants exclusively breastfeeding or exclusively feeding a cows-milk
             based formula

          -  Mothers must be older than 18 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Infants who were preterm or have medical conditions that interfere with feeding or
             eating

          -  Mothers who had gestational diabetes or are diagnosed with a major illness requiring
             treatment or surgery

          -  Mothers who will be going back to work full-time before the infant is 4 months old

          -  Mothers who are allergic to any vegetables

          -  Subjects will not be excluded because of economic status, gender, race or ethnicity.

intervention.description: Groups differ in the timing and duration of exposure to flavored food experience.
intervention.intervention_name: Timing of Diet and Flavor Experience

clinical_study.official_title: Sensitive Periods in Human Flavor Learning

primary_outcome.description: Psychophysical testing conducted on dyad to determine sensitivity and preference for a variety of food flavors.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Once a month from ages 2 weeks - 15 months

primary_outcome.description: Infants and mothers will be weighed and measured and stool and urine samples will be collected for later analysis of biomarkers of growth.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Once a month from ages 2 weeks - 15 months

reference.citation: Mennella JA, Jagnow CP, Beauchamp GK. Prenatal and postnatal flavor learning by human infants. Pediatrics. 2001 Jun;107(6):E88.

Forestell CA, Mennella JA. Early determinants of fruit and vegetable acceptance. Pediatrics. 2007 Dec;120(6):1247-54.

Llewellyn CH, van Jaarsveld CH, Johnson L, Carnell S, Wardle J. Development and factor structure of the Baby Eating Behaviour Questionnaire in the Gemini birth cohort. Appetite. 2011 Oct;57(2):388-96. doi: 10.1016/j.appet.2011.05.324. Epub 2011 Jun 6.
Pliner P, Hobden K. Development of a scale to measure the trait of food neophobia in humans. Appetite. 1992 Oct;19(2):105-20.
Gerrish CJ, Mennella JA. Flavor variety enhances food acceptance in formula-fed infants. Am J Clin Nutr. 2001 Jun;73(6):1080-5.

Mennella JA, Nicklaus S, Jagolino AL, Yourshaw LM. Variety is the spice of life: strategies for promoting fruit and vegetable acceptance during infancy. Physiol Behav. 2008 Apr 22;94(1):29-38. Epub 2007 Nov 21.

secondary_outcome.description: Mothers will complete a variety of standardized questionnaires to assess infant temperament, growth and behavior.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once a month from ages 2 weeks - 15 months

secondary_outcome.description: Saliva will be collected for subsequent determination of obesity- and taste-related genes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once a month from ages 2 weeks - 15 months

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator)
